turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Morpeth, Northumberland.
turn.1: Where is Morpeth, Northumberland located on the World Map?
turn.2: Morpeth, Northumberland Morpeth is a historic market town in Northumberland, North East England, lying on the River Wansbeck.
turn.3: What other towns and villages are nearby?
turn.4: Nearby villages include Mitford, Clifton and Pegswood.
turn.5: What is the population of the town?
turn.6: In the 2011 census, the population of Morpeth was given as 14,017, up from 13,833 in the 2001 census.
turn.8: The earliest record of the town is believed to be from the Neolithic period.
turn.9: What is the meaning of the town's name?
turn.10: The meaning of the town's name is uncertain, but it may refer to its position on the road to Scotland and a murder which occurred on that road.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: An alternative origin is a derivation of 'murderers' path' from the time when the gallows were on the Common.
